org.kynosarges.tektosyne

Class Fortran

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kynosarges.tektosyne.Fortran

  • public final class Fortran
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides functions defined by the Fortran 90 standard. Fortran supplements the standard Math class with methods that mimic selected Fortran 90 functions. Overloads for various numeric types are provided to avoid type casting.

    • Method Detail

      • aint

        public static double aint(double n)
        Returns the whole Double number nearest the specified number, rounded towards zero. Returns the result of the standard method Math.floor(double) or Math.ceil(double), depending on the sign of n.
        Parameters:
        n - the Double number to round
        Returns:
        the whole Double number nearest n whose absolute value is less than or equal to n

      • aint

        public static float aint(float n)
        Returns the whole Float number nearest the specified number, rounded towards zero. Returns the result of the standard method Math.floor(double) or Math.ceil(double), depending on the sign of n.
        Parameters:
        n - the Float number to round
        Returns:
        the whole Float number nearest n whose absolute value is less than or equal to n

      • anint

        public static double anint(double n)
        Returns the Double number nearest the specified number, using standard rounding. Always rounds numbers midway between two integral values away from zero.
        Parameters:
        n - the Double number to round
        Returns:
        the whole Double number nearest to n

      • anint

        public static float anint(float n)
        Returns the Float number nearest the specified number, using standard rounding. Always rounds numbers midway between two integral values away from zero.
        Parameters:
        n - the Float number to round
        Returns:
        the whole Float number nearest to n

      • ceiling

        public static int ceiling(double n)
        Returns the Integer nearest the specified Double number, rounded towards positive infinity. Returns the result of the standard Math.ceil(double) method, cast to Integer.
        Parameters:
        n - the Double number to round
        Returns:
        the Integer number nearest to n
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the rounded result overflows Integer

      • ceiling

        public static int ceiling(float n)

        Returns:
        the Integer number nearest to n
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the rounded result overflows Integer

      • knint

        public static long knint(double n)
        Returns the Long number nearest the specified Double, using standard rounding. Equivalent to casting the result of anint(double) to Long.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the Long number nearest to n

        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the rounded result overflows Long

        public static double max(double... args)

        Parameters:
        args - the Double numbers to compare with each other.
        Returns:
        the largest Double number found among args
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if args is null

      • modulo

        public static double modulo(double a,
                            double p)
        Returns the first Double number modulo the second number. Provides the Double equivalent of the standard Math.floorMod(int, int) method. See there for details.
        Parameters:
        a - the Double number indicating the dividend
        p - the Double number indicating the divisor
        Returns:
        the Double number that equals a modulo p
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if p is zero or the intermediate floor(double) result overflows Integer

      • modulo

        public static float modulo(float a,
                           float p)
        Returns the first Float number modulo the second number. Provides the Float equivalent of the standard Math.floorMod(int, int) method. See there for details.
        Parameters:
        a - the Float number indicating the dividend
        p - the Float number indicating the divisor
        Returns:
        the Float number that equals a modulo p
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if p is zero or the intermediate floor(float) result overflows Integer

      • modulo

        public static int modulo(int a,
                         int p)
        Returns the first Integer number modulo the second number. Returns the result of the standard Math.floorMod(int, int) method. See there for details.
        Parameters:
        a - the Integer number indicating the dividend
        p - the Integer number indicating the divisor
        Returns:
        the Integer number that equals a modulo p
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if p is zero

      • modulo

        public static long modulo(long a,
                          long p)
        Returns the first Long number modulo the second number. Returns the result of the standard Math.floorMod(int, int) method. See there for details.
        Parameters:
        a - the Long number indicating the dividend
        p - the Long number indicating the divisor
        Returns:
        the Long number that equals a modulo p
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if p is zero

      • sum

        public static double sum(double... args)
        Returns the sum of the specified Double numbers. Returns zero if no arguments are supplied.
        Parameters:
        args - the Double numbers to sum up.
        Returns:
        the Double number that is the sum of all args
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if args is null

      • sum

        public static float sum(float... args)
        Returns the sum of the specified Float numbers. Returns zero if no arguments are supplied.
        Parameters:
        args - the Float numbers to sum up.
        Returns:
        the Float number that is the sum of all args
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if args is null

      • sum

        public static int sum(int... args)
        Returns the sum of the specified Integer numbers. Returns zero if no arguments are supplied.
        Parameters:
        args - the Integer numbers to sum up.
        Returns:
        the Integer number that is the sum of all args
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the sum overflows Integer at any point
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if args is null

      • sum

        public static long sum(long... args)
        Returns the sum of the specified Long numbers. Returns zero if no arguments are supplied.
        Parameters:
        args - the Long numbers to sum up.
        Returns:
        the Long number that is the sum of all args
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the sum overflows Long at any point
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if args is null
